title: Order of Transformations
text: The first step is to recognize the order of transformations. First, $$x^2$$ is vertically compressed by a factor of $$\frac{1}{2}$$, then, shifted to the right $$5$$ units, and lastly, shifted up $$1$$ unit.
speech: The first step is to recognize the order of transformations. First,  x squared  is vertically compressed by a factor of  1 half , then, shifted to the right  5  units, and lastly, shifted up  1  unit.
pacedSpeech: The first step is to recognize the order of transformations. First,   x squared
is vertically compressed by a factor of   1 half

title: Vertically Compressing by a Factor of $$3$$
text: To vertically compress the function by a factor of $$\frac{1}{2}$$, multiply the entire function by $$\frac{1}{2}$$ to get $$\frac{1}{2} f{\left(x\right)}$$.
speech: To vertically compress the function by a factor of  1 half , multiply the entire function by  1 half  to get , 1 half f of x .
pacedSpeech: To vertically compress the function by a factor of   1 half
, multiply the entire function by   1 half
to get  , 1 half f of x

title: Shifting Right Five Units
text: To shift the function right five units, replace $$x$$ with $$x-5$$ in the function.

title: Shifting Up One Unit
text: To shift the function up one unit, add $$1$$ to the function.
